This is SDH release #951  for the wrestling fans from a wrestling fan. First aired and captured in H264 AVCHD at 8,000 kbps from the 16:9 widescreen 1280 x 720p resolution HD source on 01/28/2013 on the USA HD channel on DirecTv HDTV Digital Satellite. Framerate is 59.940 with an average Video Bitrate of 6,000 kbps in a High Quality 3.99 GB 720p H264 AVCHD MP4 release with 48khz 384 kbps AAC 2 channel stereo audio show runtime 2 Hours 20 minutes 35 seconds.
 
This is my 220th official 720p H264 AVCHD-SC-SDH release. Enjoy the show WWE fans. 

This release is only 1 part this week because the file size is less then 4 GB. This release is in H264 AVCHD MP4 format with AAC 2 channel stereo audio.  It is playable with Sony Playstation 3, Xbox 360, Samsung Galaxy S III smartphones, iPhone, iPad, VLC player as well as Media Player Classic, Windows Media Player, and any other devices capable of playing 720p HD MP4 video files with AAC 2 channel stereo audio.


If you want this show in MKV format it is easy to convert it from MP4 to MKV using MKVtoolnix 2.2.0 (MKVmerge 2.2.0) which you can download from here: <a href=" http://www.bunkus.org/videotools/mkvtoolnix/win32/mkvtoolnix-2.2.0-setup.exe" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.bunkus.org/videotools/mkvtoolnix/win32/mkvtoolnix-2.2.0-setup.exe</a>

Here's how to do it:  Download and install MKVMerge (Use link above). It is a free program that allows you to take video and audio files and convert them into MKV files on the fly, making it a very quick conversion.

Open MKVMerge on your computer, and you will be greeted by its home menu. Click the "Add" button that is near the top of the program, and a new window will appear giving you access to your computer's files. Locate your MP4 video and select it. Press "Open," and it will load into MKVMerge.

Press the "Browse" button at the bottom of the program, and a window will appear. Locate a place on your computer to save the new MKV file after it is created. Once you have found a place, click "Save" to save the location. Click the "Start Muxing" button at the bottom of the program and your MKV file will be created. Depending on the size of the file, it could take a few minutes. Once it is finished locate the MKV file after the program congratulates you on the conversion and play it as you would any other video file.

To ensure that you can get proper playback be sure you have installed the K-lite codec pack full version or mega version both of which comes with Media Player Classic Home Cinema and configure it properly for .mkv playback. If you do not have it you can get it here below: 
 <a href="
http://www.free-codecs.com/download/K_Lite_Codec_Pack.htm" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.free-codecs.com/download/K_Lite_Codec_Pack.htm</a> 

Once installed you can playback the .mkv file with the following players:

Media Player Classic, Power DVD, or Windows Media Player. 

VLC player doesnt play the MKV video only the audio for some unknown reason, so use the above players or you can burn the .mkv video file to a DVD -R disc or load it onto a USB flash drive and play it back on any BluRay player that is MKV compatible and has a USB port like my Panasonic DMP BD75 BluRay player and LG BP620 3D BluRay player does.

Enjoy the WWE Monday Night Raw Supershow wrestling fans and thanks for downloading my WWE Monday Night Raw Supershow 2013-01-28 720p AVCHD-SC-SDH release.
